title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys Hope Girls Hope (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: process is quick and seems very general. It was two different people to talk with. They were both very friendly and it was informal. It seemed like they did not have set questions and was really more of a conversation.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have working with youth in urban settings?

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Boys Hope Girls Hope (Cleveland, OH) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and had a phone interview approximately two weeks later. The phone interview went well (typical questions) and then I was interviewed onsite by the executive director the following week. The guy was clearly unprepared for the interview and wasn't especially polite. In the end, after spending hundreds of dollars flying across the country for the interview, I never heard a word back. How rude!

title: Residential Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boys Hope Girls Hope (Irvine, CA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by the Executive Director and Program coordinator. They were easy to speak with, nice and very informative. They shared of their personal experiences being residential counselors previously and they shared different scenarios of issues/routines/planning that would be involved with the job in depth. They told me I would be a great fit but that I would have to complete an online application, pass the background check and meet the girls before I get an official offer to work in the girls home. (Live-In Counselor) They sounded hopeful and excited as I was feeling.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your previous work, why you want to work here and what your future goals are?

title: Residential Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boys Hope Girls Hope
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with the program director, once interview was over position was offered on the spot on a conditional basis. Accepted and then references were called and I was background checked. I was also asked to come in to have dinner with the kids and meet them
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a difficult teen?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys Hope Girls Hope
Interview Descriptions: Saw an ad posting for the position and sent my resume and cover letter to an email listed in the posting. Less than a week later I was contacted for a phone interview by the supervisor for the position I was applying for. The phone interview took place about a week later. I thought the phone interview went well. He asked traditional questions - "name a time when..." At the end I was told I would hear back in the next week or so if I would be moving forward and that I would not hear back if I was not moving forward. However the interviewer told me I could email him with questions if I didn't receive a call. I sent a thank you email later that day. About a week later I hadn't heard anything back, but just to confirm that I was not moving forward, I sent a follow-up email. A week later I sent another. He never responded to any of my emails.
Interview Questions: Name a time when you overcame a challenge with a student.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boys Hope Girls Hope (Cincinnati, OH)
Interview Descriptions: I followed up with an ad on Craigslist for an administrative position. I was contacted the next business day, but was unable to reach my phone so I was left a message. When trying to call back, it went to voicemail 3 times, where it said the voicemail was full.

title: Community Resource Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boys Hope Girls Hope in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Someone from the National Office reaches out to you for the initial interview. If it goes well, they talk to the affiliate to see if the affiliate is interested in interviewing you. Then, the affiliate interviews you. If it is favorable, you are offered the position. As I was out of state, both interviews were conducted over the phone. The first interview was one on one. The second was supposed to be a Skype interview, but their webcam was broken. The second interview was two staff members and myself. This format may differ depending on circumstances. Both interviews are conducted using a pre-set questionnaire so some repeat questions may arise.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a Community Resource Coordinator?

title: Residential Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys Hope Girls Hope (Phoenix, AZ) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Too Long: 3-4 interviews, each lasting about 40 min. You may have to interview with multiple people at once. The first will be a phone interview. You may also get a chance to meet the children you will be working with.

title: Residential Counselor Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Boys Hope Girls Hope (Phoenix, AZ) in Jan 2008
Interview Descriptions: had an initial phone screen and was then flown to phoenx about 3 weeks later to meet with the program director and girls who live in the group home.  i was offered the position the last day of the home visit.
Interview Questions: why do you want to work in the non-profit sector?
